intro: Eucrosia peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian golden lily, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Colchicaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or mountainous terrain. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. Eucrosia peruviana is valued both for its ornamental beauty and its traditional use in Andean cultures.
